metadata.title: CVE-2021-44504 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in FIS GT.M through V7.0-000 (related to the YottaDB code base). Using crafted input, an attacker can cause a size variable, stored as an signed int, to equal an extremely large value, which is interpreted as a negative value during a check. This value is then used in a memcpy call on the stack, causing a memory segmentation fault.

criterions.comment: fis-gtm package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
